definition: practical joke/prank/to play a practical joke

sentences.english: Money can be good or bad, but prajna is always good.
sentences.chinese: 財富有善有惡，般若則無有不善。

sentences.english: Thus man restrains himself from the evil doings and does good things.
sentences.chinese: 人於是就收斂起自己惡的一面，於是就積善行德。

sentences.english: The Navajos and the Hopi strongly dislike eye contact.
sentences.chinese: 納瓦霍人和霍皮人都不喜歡惡眼神接觸。

sentences.english: Young people must be taught to learn the differnces between good and evil.
sentences.chinese: 必須教導青年人學會區分善與惡。

sentences.english: The code to vest the government with unrestricted power is a "bad" code.
sentences.chinese: 賦予政府不受約束之權力的規矩是“惡”法。

sentences.english: O Jerusalem, wash thine heart from wickedness, that thou mayest be saved.
sentences.chinese: 耶路撒冷阿，你當洗去心中的惡，使你可以得救。

sentences.english: A good seaman is known in bad weather.
Relax", said the night-man, " We are programmed to receive.
sentences.chinese: “置松點，”值夜的說到，“我們部署惡了接受。

sentences.english: Cain, did evil in God's sight.
sentences.chinese: 該隱作神眼中看爲惡的事。

sentences.english: If a man evil, and when what way?
He gives several other reasons why they are bad as well.
sentences.chinese: 他給還給了其它一些原因，證明他們爲什麼是惡。

sentences.english: It is beyond argument that every human being is a composite of good and evil.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都是善與惡的混合體，這是無可爭辯的事實。

sentences.english: And if ye offer the blind for sacrifice, is it not evil?
sentences.chinese: 你們將瞎眼的獻爲祭物，這不爲惡嗎。

sentences.english: ENan happened to hear the words of the QinQiong.
sentences.chinese: 湊巧惡男聽到秦瓊的言語。

sentences.english: and if ye offer the lame and sick, is it not evil?
sentences.chinese: 將瘸腿的，有病的獻上，這不爲惡嗎。

sentences.english: I dare say we shall find our way home without the crumbs.
sentences.chinese: 我敢說沒有這些惡麪包屑我們也應能夠找到回家的路。

definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
